metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40982 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Information exposure through microarchitectural state after transientexecution in certain vector execution units for some Intel(R) Processorsmay allow an authenticated user to potentially enable informationdisclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.129').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1').
